meanings.sent1: The interspace between the two trees was filled with colorful flowers.

meanings.definition: To place or insert something between other things.
meanings.sent1: He carefully interspaced the books on the shelf to make them all fit.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to interspace slices of tomato between the layers of cheese.
meanings.sent3: The magician interspaced colorful scarves between his fingers and made them disappear.
meanings.sent4: She interspaced moments of laughter between the serious discussions.
meanings.sent5: The artist interspaced dots of different colors to create a beautiful painting.
